alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 9:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Caroline, west central Westmoreland and northwestern Essex Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 909 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Potomac Creek, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Port Royal around 930 PM EDT. Bowling Green and Fort A.p. Hill around 935 PM EDT. Loretto around 950 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rappahannock Academy, Sparta, Villboro, Hustle, Guinea, Corbin, Elevon, Supply, Peeds and Central Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
